entries.meaning: In the Taixuanjing, a sequence of four lines, each of which may be unbroken, broken once, or broken twice. Each sequence is interpreted as an element of the sets of solid lines (‚öä for Heaven), once-broken lines (‚öã for Earth) and twice-broken lines (ùåÄ for Man) formed by combinations of four monograms (two digrams or bigrams, in other words) in the divination of the Taixuanjing.
